snippet: The company said in a court filing that $21 billion in cleanup costs and economic damages should be paid by Halliburton, its cement contractor for the Macondo well project.
abstract: BP says in a court filing that more than $21 billion in cleanup costs and economic damages from the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill should be paid by Halliburton, its cement contractor for the Macondo well project.
lead_paragraph: The company said in a court filing that $21 billion in cleanup costs and economic damages should be paid by Halliburton, its cement contractor for the Macondo well project.

headline.seo: BP Says Halliburton Must Pay All Gulf Spill Costs
headline.main: BP Tries to Shift Costs From Spill
